properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost is expected overnight and early Thursday morning. Temperatures will drop to near or slightly below the zero degree mark tonight under clear skies and light winds. Temperatures will rise quickly after sunrise. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T12:25:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-05T20:26:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0895116564.2019
Area: Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Kirkland Lake - Englehart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rain expected across Nova Scotia today. A low pressure system approaching from New England will track across Nova Scotia this evening. Rain at times heavy associated with this system will spread across the province this morning and then diminish to scattered showers tonight. Total rainfall amounts are generally expected to reach 30 to 40 millimetres, but some areas may receive amounts of 60 millimetres or more due to heavy showers embedded within the rain. Rainfall warnings are in effect for western Nova Scotia and it is possible that they will be extended to other regions as further information becomes available. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T15:40:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T07:41:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1180168297.2019
Area: Lunenburg County, Queens County, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Update 3: Due to a wildfire in the County of Northern Lights, a number of areas within the County must still be prepared to evacuate on short notice. Residents returning to the area north of Twin Lakes Campground including Keg River/Carcajou, to the County’s north boundary, are advised that they also should be prepared to evacuate on short notice, should a change in the fire situation occur. ### Go to www.countyofnorthernlights.com for more update information and maps. Check www.wildfire.alberta.ca for up to date wildfire information. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-06-12T10:52:12-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of County of Northern Lights, 2019-06-05T10:50:52-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5809
Area: Northern Lights #22
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of County of Northern Lights

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rain expected along the Fundy coast today. A low pressure system approaching from New England will track across Nova Scotia this evening. Rain at times heavy associated with this system will spread across southern New Brunswick this morning and then diminish to scattered showers this afternoon. At this time, total rainfall amounts are forecast to reach 30 to 40 millimetres along the Fundy coast. If the track of the system move farther north than expected, then higher rainfall amounts are possible and rainfall warnings may be issued. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T15:40:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T07:41:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0867491974.2019
Area: Saint John and County, Grand Manan and Coastal Charlotte County, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. Northwest winds today should direct smoke away from Pikangikum for much of the day before winds become northeast this evening. This may allow smoke to spread back into Pikangikum tonight. Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-07T01:01:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-06T09:02:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2809533620.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke from wildfires in northern Alberta is causing locally poor air quality and reduced visibility. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-07T03:01:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-06T11:02:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3214057870.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A low pressure system approaching from New England will track across Nova Scotia this evening. Rain at times heavy associated with this system has already started over southwestern sections of the province, and it will reach Cape Breton later this morning before ending tonight. Total rainfall amounts are expected to reach 30 to 40 millimetres, with some areas likely to receive 60 millimetres or more due to heavy showers embedded within the rain. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T23:40:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T07:41:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3128273430.2019
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. The combination of clear skies and light winds will allow temperatures to drop to near the freezing mark tonight and give frost, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
